intro: Triopterys buxifolia, commonly known as the waxleaf triopterys, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurels and cinnamon trees. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green, ovate leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating, giving it its common name. It produces small, fragrant white flowers followed by black, berry-like fruits. Triopterys buxifolia is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to various growing conditions.
